exceptions.exn: Wrong bullet -: Current bullet - is not finished.
Wrong bullet +: Current bullet + is not finished.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: Type
K_eq_dec: forall x y : K, {x = y} + {x <> y}

Goal:
forall (l : list op) (k : K), (forall k' : K, In (I k') l -> k <> k') -> op_equivalent (l ++ [O k]) (O k :: l)

Premises:
Inductive op_equivalent : list op -> list op -> Prop := op_equiv_nil : op_equivalent [] [] | op_equiv_cons : forall (x : op) (xs ys : list op), op_equivalent xs ys -> op_equivalent (x :: xs) (x :: ys) | op_equiv_move : forall (x y : op) (xs ys : list op), good_op_move x y -> op_equivalent xs ys -> op_equivalent (x :: y :: xs) (y :: x :: ys) | op_equiv_trans : forall l1 l2 l3 : list op, op_equivalent l1 l2 -> op_equivalent l2 l3 -> op_equivalent l1 l3 Arguments op_equivalent (_ _)%list_scope Arguments op_equiv_cons _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments op_equiv_move _ _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments op_equiv_trans (_ _ _)%list_scope
In : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> Prop
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive op : Type := I : K -> op | O : K -> op
op_equivalent_all_Is_I : forall (l : list op) (k : K), (forall x : op, In x l -> exists k0 : K, x = I k0) -> op_equivalent (l ++ [I k]) (I k :: l)
IR_equivalent_all_Is_I : forall (l : list IR) (k : K), (forall x : IR, In x l -> exists k0 : K, x = IRI k0) -> IR_equivalent (l ++ [IRI k]) (IRI k :: l)
good_op_move_neq_IO : forall k k' : K, k <> k' -> good_op_move (I k) (O k')
IR_equiv_AAOF_II_neq : forall (xs ys : list op) (target : list IR) (k k' : K), k <> k' -> op_equivalent xs ys -> IR_equivalent (acknowledge_all_ops_func xs target) (acknowledge_all_ops_func ys target) -> IR_equivalent (acknowledge_all_ops_func (I k :: I k' :: xs) target) (acknowledge_all_ops_func (I k' :: I k :: ys) target)
good_op_move_good_move_IO : forall k k' : K, good_op_move (I k) (O k') -> good_move (IRI k) (IRO k')
before_head_op : forall (l : list op) (h : K) (ir : list IR), (forall k1 k2 : K, In (I k2) l -> before (O k1) (I k2) l -> before (IRO k1) (IRI k2) (IRI h :: ir)) -> forall x : op, In (I h) l -> before x (I h) l -> exists k : K, x = I k
not_good_op_move_OI : forall k k' : K, good_op_move (O k) (I k') -> False
acknowledge_all_ops_sind : forall P : list op -> list IR -> SProp, P [] [] -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), ~ acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (I k :: tr) (IRI k :: IRU k :: out)) -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), ~ acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (I k :: tr) out) -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (I k :: tr) (IRI k :: out)) -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (O k :: tr) (IRO k :: out)) ->...-> P l l0
acknowledge_all_ops_ind : forall P : list op -> list IR -> Prop, P [] [] -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), ~ acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (I k :: tr) (IRI k :: IRU k :: out)) -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), ~ acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (I k :: tr) out) -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (I k :: tr) (IRI k :: out)) -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (O k :: tr) (IRO k :: out)) ->...-> P l l0
acknowledged_op_I_cons_reduce : forall (k k' : K) (l : list op), acknowledged_op k (I k' :: l) -> acknowledged_op k l
acknowledged_op_I_cons_expand : forall (k k' : K) (l : list op), acknowledged_op k l -> acknowledged_op k (I k' :: l)
acknowledge_all_ops_func_IRU_In : forall (l : list op) (ir : list IR) (k : K), In (IRU k) (acknowledge_all_ops_func l ir) -> In (I k) l
good_op_move_OO : forall k k' : K, good_op_move (O k) (O k')
good_move_IO_neq : forall k k' : K, k <> k' -> good_move (IRI k) (IRO k')
good_move_IU_neq : forall k k' : K, k <> k' -> good_move (IRI k) (IRU k')
good_op_move_II : forall k k' : K, good_op_move (I k) (I k')
acknowledge_all_ops_was_in : forall (l : list op) (ir : list IR), acknowledge_all_ops l ir -> forall k : K, In (IRI k) ir -> In (I k) l
Inductive acknowledge_all_ops : list op -> list IR -> Prop := AAO_nil : acknowledge_all_ops [] [] | AAO_IU : forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), ~ acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> acknowledge_all_ops (I k :: tr) (IRI k :: IRU k :: out) | AAO_I_dorp : forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), ~ acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out ->...-> acknowledge_all_ops (O k :: tr) (IRO k :: out) Arguments acknowledge_all_ops (_ _)%list_scope Arguments AAO_IU _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments AAO_I_dorp _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments AAO_IO _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments AAO_O _ (_ _)%list_scope
acknowledge_all_ops_func_target_ext : forall (l : list op) (t t' : list IR), (forall k : K, In (IRU k) t -> In (IRU k) t') -> (forall k : K, In (IRU k) t' -> In (IRU k) t) -> acknowledge_all_ops_func l t = acknowledge_all_ops_func l t'
IR_equiv_AAOF_I : forall (k : K) (xs ys : list op) (target : list IR), op_equivalent xs ys -> IR_equivalent (acknowledge_all_ops_func xs target) (acknowledge_all_ops_func ys target) -> IR_equivalent (acknowledge_all_ops_func (I k :: xs) target) (acknowledge_all_ops_func (I k :: ys) target)
op_rec : forall P : op -> Set, (forall k : K, P (I k)) -> (forall k : K, P (O k)) -> forall o : op, P o
op_rect : forall P : op -> Type, (forall k : K, P (I k)) -> (forall k : K, P (O k)) -> forall o : op, P o
op_ind : forall P : op -> Prop, (forall k : K, P (I k)) -> (forall k : K, P (O k)) -> forall o : op, P o
op_sind : forall P : op -> SProp, (forall k : K, P (I k)) -> (forall k : K, P (O k)) -> forall o : op, P o
AAO_IO : forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> acknowledge_all_ops (I k :: tr) (IRI k :: out)

```coq
intros l k H.
induction l as [|x xs IHl].
- simpl. rewrite op_equiv_cons. apply op_equiv_refl.
- destruct x as [k'|k'].
  + (* x = I k' *)
    simpl. rewrite IHl. apply op_equiv_cons.
    intros k1. intros Hk1.
    destruct (K_eq_dec k k1) as [Hkk1|Hkneqk1].
    * (* k = k1 *)
      subst k1. contradiction.
    * (* k <> k1 *)
      apply good_op_move_neq_IO. auto.
  + (* x = O k' *)
    simpl. rewrite IHl. apply op_equiv_cons.
    intros k1. intros Hk1.
    destruct (K_eq_dec k k1) as [Hkk1|Hkneqk1].
    * (* k = k1 *)
      subst k1. contradiction.
    * (* k <> k1 *)
      apply good_op_move_OO. auto.
Qed.

original: intros l k H. induction l as [|x xs IHl]. - simpl. rewrite op_equiv_cons. apply op_equiv_refl. - destruct x as [k'|k']. + simpl. rewrite IHl. apply op_equiv_cons. intros k1. intros Hk1. destruct (K_eq_dec k k1) as [Hkk1|Hkneqk1]. * subst k1. contradiction. * apply good_op_move_neq_IO. auto. + simpl. rewrite IHl. apply op_equiv_cons. intros k1. intros Hk1. destruct (K_eq_dec k k1) as [Hkk1|Hkneqk1]. * subst k1. contradiction. * apply good_op_move_OO. auto.
